wikipedia_page.main: Abigail J. Thaw (born 1 October 1965) is an English actress.

response: At the new Globe Theatre in 2001, a cast of six (including Abigail Thaw, Mark Rylance, and Richard Hope) used extensive doubling for the play. The cast wore identical costumes even when in disguise, allowing for particular comic effects related to doubling (as when Cloten attempts to disguise himself as Posthumus.)
In January 2017, she made a guest appearance in an episode of Inspector Morse prequel Endeavour alongside her stepdaughter Abigail Thaw.
* Abigail Thaw (born 1965), British actress (daughter of John Thaw)

Nigel Whitmey (born 23 February 1963) is a British-Canadian actor who has appeared in TV series and films. He is also the husband of the actress Abigail Thaw, whom he met while training at RADA.

At RADA, Whitmey met actress Abigail Thaw whom he married in 1986. They have two children; Molly Mae, born 1997, and Talia, born 2003. He has worked chiefly in Britain in film, television and voice overs.

Hastings' 1950's play The Cutting of the Cloth saw its world premiere at the Southwark Playhouse in London, from 11 March till 4 April 2015. The cast were Alexis Caley, Andy de la Tour, James El-Sharawy, Paul Rider and Abigail Thaw, directed by Tricia Thorns.Southwark Playhouse playbill, 2015.

ITV broadcast a television film in the UK on 2 January 2012; in the United States, PBS aired it on 1 July 2012. It starred Shaun Evans as the eponymous police detective in his early career. Abigail Thaw, daughter of the original Morse actor John Thaw, played the part of Dorothea Frazil (the name is a pun on Frazil ice vs. thaw) in a scene at the Oxford Mail newspaper.
The original cast was led by Hayley Mills as Ursula, Belinda Lang as Janet, Carol MacReady as Dorcas and Robert Rees as Andrea.  Robert Duncan played Dr Mead and Abigail Thaw was Olga.

Dorothea Frazil is the editor of the Oxford Mail Newspaper. Since the pilot episode, she has been portrayed by Abigail Thaw, the daughter of original Morse actor, John Thaw. Ms. Frazil helps Morse and the Oxford City Police with information pertaining to many different and difficult cases. Although her relationship with Morse is initially strained due to their respective professions and Morse's belief that any association with the newspaper would be corruptive, it soon softens to the point where the two consider each other as friends.
In keeping with actress Abigail Thaw's family connections with the series, the name "Frazil" is a pun on Frazil ice vs. thaw.
*Abigail Thaw as Abby
* Abigail Thaw as DS Sullivan

In the summer of 1964, Alexander married actor John Thaw; they divorced four years later. She has a daughter from this marriage, actress Abigail Thaw. Alexander’s granddaughter Molly Whitmey made a cameo in the Endeavour episode Oracle (series 7, episode 1, broadcast 1 February 2020) as the younger version of Alexander.
* Abigail Thaw as Caroline
